cards.name: Bulbasaur

attacks.name: Poison Seed
attacks.effect: Inflicts poison on the opponent.

cards.description: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.

cards.name: Ivysaur
cards.description: When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flower’s coming bloom.

cards.name: Venusaur

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.effect: Confuses the Pokémon after attacking.

cards.description: Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

cards.name: Charmander

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.effect: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Charmander.

cards.description: The flame at the tip of its tail makes a sound as it burns. You can only hear it in quiet places.

cards.name: Charmeleon

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.effect: Discard 2 Fire Energies attached to Charmeleon.

cards.description: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.

cards.name: Charizard

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.effect: Discard 1 Fire Energy attached to Charizard.

cards.description: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.

cards.name: Squirtle

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.effect: May paralyze the opponent.

cards.description: Shoots water at prey while in the water. Withdraws into its shell when in danger.

cards.name: Wartortle

attacks.name: Aqua Tail
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.description: It often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For swimming fast, it moves its ears to maintain balance.

cards.name: Blastoise

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached.

cards.description: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.

cards.name: Caterpie

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.effect: May paralyze the opponent.

cards.description: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antennae on its head to drive away enemies.

cards.name: Metapod

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to Metapod by attacks if that damage is 30 or less.

cards.description: This Pokémon is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

cards.name: Butterfree

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.effect: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

cards.description: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

cards.name: Weedle

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.

cards.name: Kakuna

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Kakuna during your opponent's next turn.

cards.description: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

cards.name: Beedrill

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.effect: The opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

cards.name: Pidgey
cards.description: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

cards.name: Pidgeotto

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.effect: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

cards.description: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

cards.name: Pidgeot

attacks.name: Hurricane
attacks.effect: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

cards.description: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

cards.name: Rattata
cards.description: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

cards.name: Raticate

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: It uses its whiskers to maintain its balance. It apparently slows down if they are cut off.

cards.name: Spearow
cards.description: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.

cards.name: Fearow

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Fearow during your opponent's next turn.

cards.description: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

cards.name: Ekans

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds, such as Pidgey and Spearow, whole.

cards.name: Arbok

attacks.name: Poison Fang
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.

cards.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.description: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.

cards.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.effect: Discard all Energy cards attached to Raichu.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, Raichu does 30 damage to itself.

cards.description: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

cards.name: Sandshrew

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.effect: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.description: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.

cards.name: Sandslash

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

cards.name: Nidoran♀

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: Although small, its venomous barbs render this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

cards.name: Nidorina

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.

cards.name: Nidoqueen

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.

cards.name: Nidoran♂

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: Its large ears are flapped like wings when it is listening to distant sounds. It extends toxic barbs when angered.

cards.name: Nidorino

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.

cards.name: Nidoking

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, Nidoking does 30 damage to itself.

cards.description: It uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break the prey's bones.

cards.name: Clefairy

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.description: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.

cards.name: Clefable

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.effect: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.)

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Clefable by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.description: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.

cards.name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.effect: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Vulpix.

cards.description: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.

cards.name: Ninetales

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.effect: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Ninetales.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.effect: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Ninetales.

cards.description: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1000-year curse.

cards.name: Jigglypuff

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.description: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

cards.name: Wigglytuff

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.effect: Wigglytuff does 20 damage to itself.

cards.description: Its body is very elastic. By inhaling deeply, it can continue to inflate itself without limit.

cards.name: Zubat

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.effect: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the opponent.

cards.description: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.

cards.name: Golbat
cards.description: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

cards.name: Oddish

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.effect: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.description: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

cards.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.

cards.name: Vileplume

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads. This Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.description: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

cards.name: Paras

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by drawing nutrients from the bug host.

cards.name: Parasect

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.description: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.

cards.name: Venonat

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night.

cards.name: Venomoth

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.

cards.name: Diglett

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.description: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground.

cards.name: Dugtrio

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.effect: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.description: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

cards.name: Meowth

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

cards.description: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

cards.name: Persian
cards.description: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

cards.name: Psyduck

attacks.name: Headache
attacks.effect: Your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from their hand during their next turn.

cards.description: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokémon will use psychokinetic powers.

cards.name: Golduck

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Golduck.

cards.description: Often seen swimming elegantly by lakeshores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.

cards.name: Mankey

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant.

cards.name: Primeape

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on Primeape.

cards.description: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it is caught.

cards.name: Growlithe

attacks.name: Flame Wheel
attacks.effect: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Growlithe.

cards.description: Very friendly and faithful to people. It will try to repel enemies by barking and biting.

cards.name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.effect: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Arcanine.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.effect: Arcanine does 30 damage to itself.

cards.description: A Pokémon that has been admired since the past for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.

cards.name: Poliwag

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming than trying to stand.

cards.name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.

cards.name: Poliwrath

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.effect: Poliwrath does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwrath.

cards.description: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.

cards.name: Abra

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and teleport to safety.

cards.name: Kadabra

attacks.name: Confusion
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.description: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close by.

cards.name: Alakazam

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.effect: Discard 1 Psychic Energy attached to Alakazam in order to remove all damage counters from Alakazam.

cards.description: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.

cards.name: Machop
cards.description: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.

cards.name: Machoke

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.effect: Does 50 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machoke.

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.effect: Machoke does 20 damage to itself.

cards.description: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

cards.name: Machamp

attacks.name: Cross Chop
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.description: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.

cards.name: Bellsprout

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: A carnivorous Pokémon that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.

cards.name: Weepinbell

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: It spits out poison powder to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of acid.

cards.name: Victreebel

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.description: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

cards.name: Tentacool

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

cards.name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Tentacruel.

cards.description: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

cards.name: Geodude
cards.description: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

cards.name: Graveler

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.effect: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.description: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

cards.name: Golem

attacks.name: Self-Destruct
attacks.effect: This Pokémon does 100 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.effect: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.description: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.

cards.name: Ponyta

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.effect: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Ponyta.

cards.description: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything completely flat in little time.

cards.name: Rapidash

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.effect: Discard 2 Fire Energies attached to Rapidash.

cards.description: Just loves to run. If it sees something faster than itself, it will give chase at top speed.

cards.name: Slowpoke
cards.description: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

cards.name: Slowbro

attacks.name: Confusion
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.description: The Shellder that is latched onto Slowpoke's tail is said to feed on the host's leftover scraps.

cards.name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Self-Destruct
attacks.effect: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

cards.description: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses Thunder Wave and similar moves.

cards.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Self-Destruct
attacks.effect: This Pokémon does 100 damage to itself.

cards.description: Formed by several Magnemite linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

cards.name: Farfetch'd

attacks.name: Leek Slap
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. It is used much like a metal sword.

cards.name: Doduo

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

cards.name: Dodrio

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.effect: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on Dodrio.

cards.description: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.

cards.name: Seel

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.

cards.name: Dewgong

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

cards.name: Grimer

attacks.name: Sludge
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

cards.name: Muk

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sludge Bomb
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

cards.name: Shellder

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.description: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

cards.name: Cloyster

attacks.name: Clamp
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.

cards.name: Gastly

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.

cards.name: Haunter

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.effect: If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

cards.description: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

cards.name: Gengar

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.description: Under a full moon, this Pokémon likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

cards.name: Onix

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to Onix by attacks if that damage is 30 or less.

cards.description: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black.

cards.name: Drowzee

attacks.name: Confusion
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.description: Puts enemies to sleep then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.

cards.name: Hypno

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.effect: If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

cards.description: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

cards.name: Krabby
cards.description: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.

cards.name: Kingler
cards.description: The large pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, it is so heavy, it is difficult to aim.

cards.name: Voltorb

attacks.name: Self-Destruct
attacks.effect: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.

cards.description: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

cards.name: Electrode

attacks.name: Self-Destruct
attacks.effect: This Pokémon does 100 damage to itself.

cards.description: It stores electric energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

cards.name: Exeggcute

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.effect: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.description: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.

cards.name: Exeggutor

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.description: Its cries are very noisy. This is because each of the three heads thinks about whatever it likes.

cards.name: Cubone
cards.description: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this Pokémon's real face.

cards.name: Marowak

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on Marowak.

cards.description: Small and weak, this Pokémon is adept with its bone club. It has grown more vicious over the ages.

cards.name: Hitmonlee

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.description: This amazing Pokémon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.

cards.name: Hitmonchan
cards.description: While apparently doing nothing, it fires punches in lightning-fast volleys that are impossible to see.

cards.name: Lickitung

attacks.name: Tongue Wrap
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.description: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a tingling sensation when it licks enemies.

cards.name: Koffing

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.

cards.name: Weezing

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Explosion
attacks.effect: This Pokémon does 60 damage to itself.

cards.description: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, 2 Koffing can fuse into a Weezing over many years.

cards.name: Rhyhorn

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.description: Its massive bones are 1,000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.

cards.name: Rhydon

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.effect: Rhydon does 30 damage to itself.

cards.description: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

cards.name: Chansey

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Chansey during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.effect: Chansey does 80 damage to itself.

cards.description: A rare and elusive Pokémon that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to get it.

cards.name: Tangela

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.effect: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. Its vines shake as it walks.

cards.name: Kangaskhan

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.effect: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on Kangaskhan.

cards.description: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is 3 years old.

cards.name: Horsea

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

cards.name: Seadra

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Seadra during your opponent's next turn.

cards.description: Capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

cards.name: Goldeen
cards.description: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of the Water Queen.

cards.name: Seaking
cards.description: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.

cards.name: Staryu
cards.description: An enigmatic Pokémon that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.

cards.name: Starmie

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.effect: Discard 1 Water Energy attached to Starmie in order to remove all damage counters from Starmie.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Starmie.

cards.description: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.

cards.name: Mr. Mime

attacks.name: Barrier
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Mr. Mime during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: If interrupted while it is miming, it will slap around the offender with its broad hands.

cards.name: Scyther

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.effect: During your next turn, Scyther's Slash attack's base damage is doubled.

cards.description: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.

cards.name: Jynx

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.

cards.name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Thunder Punch
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage. If tails, Electabuzz does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Light Screen
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Electabuzz by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.description: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

cards.name: Magmar

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.effect: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Magmar.

cards.description: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

cards.name: Pinsir
cards.description: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing it around and toss it hard.

cards.name: Tauros

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Rampage
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on Tauros. Tauros is now Confused.

cards.description: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

cards.name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.effect: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Magikarp.

cards.description: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

cards.name: Gyarados

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.effect: Discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

cards.name: Lapras

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.description: A Pokémon that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across the water.

cards.name: Ditto

attacks.name: Transform
attacks.effect: Ditto copies the Defending Pokémon's attacks, except for its Energy cost.

cards.description: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

cards.name: Eevee

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.description: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element stones.

cards.name: Vaporeon

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Vaporeon.

cards.description: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.

cards.name: Jolteon

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.effect: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10000-volt lightning bolts.

cards.name: Flareon

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.effect: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Flareon.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.effect: Discard 2 Fire Energies attached to Flareon.

cards.description: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees.

cards.name: Porygon

attacks.name: Conversion 1
attacks.effect: Change Porygon's type to the type of one of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Conversion 2
attacks.effect: Change Porygon's resistance to a type of your choice other than Colorless.

cards.description: A Pokémon that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.

cards.name: Omanyte
cards.description: An ancient Pokémon that was recovered from a fossil. It swims by cleverly twisting its 10 tentacles about.

cards.name: Omastar

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omastar.

cards.description: A prehistoric Pokémon that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible to catch prey.

cards.name: Kabuto
cards.description: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.

cards.name: Kabutops

attacks.name: Hydro Cutter
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.description: A slim and fast swimmer. It slices its prey with its sharp sickles and drinks the body fluids.

cards.name: Aerodactyl

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.effect: Discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: A ferocious, prehistoric Pokémon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

cards.name: Snorlax

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.effect: Discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

cards.name: Articuno

attacks.name: Freeze Dry
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.description: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

cards.name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.effect: Discard all Energy cards attached to Zapdos.

cards.description: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.

cards.name: Moltres

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.effect: Discard 2 Fire Energies attached to Moltres.

attacks.name: Sky Attack
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.description: A legendary bird Pokémon. As it flaps its flaming wings, even the night sky will turn red.

cards.name: Dratini

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently when a small colony was found living underwater.

cards.name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: A mystical Pokémon that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.

cards.name: Dragonite

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.effect: Discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Tail
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: An extremely rare Pokémon that is said to live in the sea. It can fly faster than any known Pokémon.

cards.name: Mewtwo

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Barrier
attacks.effect: Discard 1 Psychic Energy attached to Mewtwo in order to prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mewtwo during your opponent's next turn.

cards.description: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA-engineering experiments.

cards.name: Mew

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.effect: Does 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.
